comment.author: 17962436@N00
comment._content: query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9900E6DB123FE633A... NEWPORT FASHION GREETS HORSE SHOW; Grand Duke Mihailovitch of Russia in the Gay Throng -- Brilliant Costumes. September 2, 1913, Tuesday NEWPORT, R.I., Sept. 1. -- The seventeenth exhibition of the Newport Horse Show at the Casino this afternoon surpassed expectations both in the ring and outside. The attendance was in keeping with past exhibitions.

comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content: I don't think that the photos are of the Newport Casino show. The Newport Casino is very small and less than an acre. It now has tennis courts. This is the Piping Rock Club in Locust Valley, New York. I added the club to Wikipedia: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Piping_Rock_Club

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: The whipped cream of New York society turned out in October, 1912, for the eleventh annual horse show at the Piping Rock Country Club, in Locust Valley, on the north shore of Long Island. A new clubhouse and stepped observation boxes had just been opened for their pleasure: Story in The New York Times, October 4, 1912: "SOCIETY AMATEURS IN THE SADDLE "Piping Rock Horse Show Attracts Hunting Set to Locust Valley Grounds" query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?res=9D06E1D6113BE6... Another story in The New York Times, October 5, 1912: "SOCIETY AIDS AT PIPING ROCK SHOW "Notable People View Amateur Horse Exhibition Amid Long Island Hills" query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?res=9506E6D7113AE6...
